summary: Morocco, a North African country, is known for its diverse culture blending Arab, Berber, African, and European influences. With a population of 37 million, Islam is the predominant religion, and Arabic and Berber are the official languages. The country has a rich history dating back to the Paleolithic era. It reached its peak power under dynasties like the Almoravids and Almohads. Morocco gained independence from colonial rule in 1956 and has since become a stable nation with a strong economy. It is a monarchy with an elected parliament and holds significant influence in Africa and the Arab world.
title: Morocco
